conclusion: The magnetic induction intensity of the uniform magnetic field is B=0.1T, the number of turns of the rectangular coil used is n=100, the side lengths are lAB=0.2m and lBC=0.5m, and it rotates uniformly around the symmetry axis OO′ with an angular velocity ω=100π rad/s.
The coil is rectangular with sides labeled AB and BC, and it rotates around the symmetry axis OO′.
Area of one turn A = lAB · lBC = 0.20 m × 0.50 m = 0.10 m².
Magnetic flux of a N-turn coil that is rotating in a uniform field B is Φ(t) = N B A cos θ(t).
With uniform rotation θ(t) = ωt + π/2, the flux is zero at t = 0.
Induced emf (Faraday’s law) ε(t) = |dΦ/dt| = N B A ω |sin (ωt)|.
Writing the time dependence without the absolute-value sign, the usual sinusoidal form is ε(t) = εmax sin(ωt), where εmax = N B A ω.
Numerical values: N = 100 turns, B = 0.10 T, A = 0.10 m², ω = 100π rad s⁻¹.
The induced emf in the coil varies sinusoidally as ε(t) = 100 π sin(100π t) (V) with a maximum (peak) value εmax = 100 π V ≈ 314 V.
